#Text=Kurdish supporters of Syria 's Democratic Union Party in Afrin .
#Text=Image : Scott Bobb .
#Text=Even before the fall of Saddam in 2003 , Iran
#Text=reinterpreted the basically pragmatic cooperation in the field of intelligence and security .

#Text=Ever since Syria was part of a so called " axis of resistance " consisting of Iran , Syria , Hezbollah , Hamas and Islamic Jihad , the sole common strategic denominator of these different actors is hostility against Israel , which is always depicted as an aggressor against whom the Muslims should resist — hence , the [ designation as an ] " axis of resistance " .

column1: #Text=Of course , forming an alliance ' officially against Israel ' serves another purpose too : to take a stand against Saudi Arabia without naming it .
#Text=Much of the current crisis in Syria has to do with this scheme .

#Text=Farhi : Syria supported Iran during the Iran – Iraq war ; and , that dynamic forged a long-standing relationship between the two countries that includes economic , political , and military cooperation .
#Text=In more recent years , Iran , Syria and Hezbollah have self-identified as [ an ] axis of resistance against Israeli – American involvement in the region .
#Text=Despite this , Iran initially mostly followed the Russian lead in the Syria .

#Text=However as other regional players — such as Israel and Saudi Arabia , as well as extra-regional players such as the United States — began to see , and articulate the weakening of , the Assad regime as a first step to the weakening of Iran , this enhanced Iran 's threat perception , and gave it [ an ] incentive for further involvement in support of Assad .
#Text=( ( Wikinews ) ) Do you think Iranian support for the Syrian government is a way of standing up against UN sanctions imposed on them , and opposing American imperialism ?
#Text=Kamrava : No. Iranian – Syrian relations are rooted in common strategic interests rather than in assumptions about US imperialism , or the role of the UN sanctions .
#Text=Martel : Both Iran and Syria share a strategic interest in undermining the influence of the US and the West .
#Text=Posch : Definitely not .
#Text=The sanctions track is a different one , checking American " imperialism " — as you call it — is , of course .
#Text=one aim .
#Text=Farhi :

#Text=As has become evident in the past few weeks , the primary interactive dynamic regarding the Syrian imbroglio is being played out mostly in terms of US – Russian rivalry ; and , Iran is following the Russian lead .
#Text=( ( Wikinews ) )
#Text=The UN has " overwhelmingly " confirmed use of chemical weapons in Syria .
#Text=Do you think both sides have used chemical weapons ?
#Text=File photo of interviewee Mehran Kamrava .
#Text=Image : Mehran Kamrava .
#Text=Kamrava : It is undeniable that chemical weapons were used in Syria .
#Text=But , I have not yet seen conclusive evidence for the responsibility of the use of chemical gas by one side or another .

#Text=Until valid evidence is made available — proving who used chemical weapons — affixing blame to either the government forces , or to one of the fractious rebel groups , is only a matter of speculation .
#Text=Martel : I remain skeptical that anyone other than the Syrian government used chemical weapons .
#Text=It is widely accepted that the Syrian government was behind the use of chemical weapons .
#Text=Posch :
#Text=I think the Report is quite clear on that .
#Text=Farhi : I — as an academic , with no access to on the ground information — am in no position to know whether both sides have used chemical weapons .
